intro: Bupleurum pyrenaeum var. longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in calcareous soils and is often found in open woodland or rocky habitats.
